Dimension.description:
Dimension (attribute) definition.

Dimensions are used for grouping and filtering in queries.

parent.description: Parent dimension for hierarchies (e.g., 'state' parent is 'country')
parent.title: Parent

sql.description: SQL expression (defaults to name; accepts 'expr' as alias)
sql.title: Sql

Dimension.title: Dimension

Metric.description:
Measure definition - supports simple aggregations and complex metric types.

Measures can be:
- Simple aggregations: SUM(amount), COUNT(*), AVG(price)
- Ratios: revenue / order_count
- Derived formulas: (revenue - cost) / revenue
- Cumulative: running totals, period-to-date
- Time comparisons: YoY, MoM growth
- Conversion funnels: signup -> purchase rate

Auto-registers as a graph-level metric with the current semantic layer context if available.

drill_fields.description: Fields to show when drilling into this metric
drill_fields.title: Drill Fields

fill_nulls_with.description: Default value when result is NULL
fill_nulls_with.title: Fill Nulls With

non_additive_dimension.description: Dimension across which this metric cannot be summed (e.g., time for averages)
non_additive_dimension.title: Non Additive Dimension

sql.description: SQL expression or formula (accepts 'expr' as alias)
sql.title: Sql

window_expression.description: Raw SQL expression for window function (e.g., 'AVG(total_bids) FILTER (WHERE active)')
window_expression.title: Window Expression

window_frame.description: Window frame clause (e.g., 'RANGE BETWEEN INTERVAL 6 DAY PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW')
window_frame.title: Window Frame

window_order.description: Window ORDER BY column (defaults to model's default_time_dimension)
window_order.title: Window Order

Metric.title: Metric

Parameter.description:
Parameter definition for user input.

DEPRECATED: Use Jinja templates instead of Parameters.

Parameters can be referenced in filters, SQL expressions, and metric definitions
to create dynamic, user-configurable queries.

default_to_today.description: Default to current date (for date parameters)
default_to_today.title: Default To Today

Parameter.title: Parameter

PreAggregation.description:
Pre-aggregation definition for automatic query optimization.

Pre-aggregations are materialized rollup tables that store pre-computed
aggregations. The query engine automatically routes queries to matching
pre-aggregations for significant performance improvements.

Example:
    >>> PreAggregation(
    ...     name="daily_rollup",
    ...     measures=["count", "revenue"],
    ...     dimensions=["status", "region"],
    ...     time_dimension="created_at",
    ...     granularity="day",
    ...     partition_granularity="month",
    ...     refresh_key=RefreshKey(every="1 hour", incremental=True)
    ... )

build_range_end.description: SQL expression for end of data range to aggregate
build_range_end.title: Build Range End

build_range_start.description: SQL expression for start of data range to aggregate
build_range_start.title: Build Range Start

PreAggregation.title: PreAggregation

incremental.description: Whether to use incremental refresh (only update changed partitions)
incremental.title: Incremental

sql.description: SQL query that returns a value to trigger refresh when changed
sql.title: Sql

update_window.description: Time window to refresh incrementally (e.g., '7 day', '1 month')
update_window.title: Update Window

Relationship.description:
Represents a relationship between models.

Relationship types:
- many_to_one: This model has a foreign key to another
- one_to_one: This model is referenced by another with unique constraint
- one_to_many: This model is referenced by another
- many_to_many: This model relates to another through a junction table

foreign_key.description: Foreign key column (defaults to {name}_id for many_to_one)
foreign_key.title: Foreign Key

primary_key.description: Primary key column in related model (defaults to id)
primary_key.title: Primary Key

related_foreign_key.description: Foreign key in junction model pointing to related model
related_foreign_key.title: Related Foreign Key

through_foreign_key.description: Foreign key in junction model pointing to this model
through_foreign_key.title: Through Foreign Key

Relationship.title: Relationship

Segment.description:
Segment definition - predefined reusable filter.

Segments are named filters that can be applied to queries to consistently
filter data according to business definitions.

Example:
    active_users = Segment(
        name="active_users",
        sql="{model}.status = 'active' AND {model}.last_login > CURRENT_DATE - 30"
    )

public.description: Whether segment is visible in API/UI
public.title: Public

Segment.title: Segment

description: Schema for Sidemantic semantic layer YAML configuration

items.description:
Model (dataset) definition.

Models are the foundation of the semantic layer, mapping to physical tables
or SQL expressions. Auto-registers with the current semantic layer context if available.

default_grain.description: Default time granularity when using default_time_dimension
default_grain.title: Default Grain

default_time_dimension.description: Default time dimension for metrics (auto-included in queries)
default_time_dimension.title: Default Time Dimension

source_uri.description: Remote data source URI (e.g., https://, s3://, gs://)
source_uri.title: Source Uri

items.title: Model

items.description:
Parameter definition for user input.

DEPRECATED: Use Jinja templates instead of Parameters.

Parameters can be referenced in filters, SQL expressions, and metric definitions
to create dynamic, user-configurable queries.

default_to_today.description: Default to current date (for date parameters)
default_to_today.title: Default To Today
